original: Ljungholm, Hans Fredrik, hovrättsråd, Jönköping, f. 17/8/86 i Visby av bankdir. Herman Pettersson o. Helena Ljungholm. — Mog:ex. i Visby 04, fil. kand. i Upps. 08, jur. kand. 11. E. o. not. i Göta hovr. 12, tf. domhav. f. g. 13, tjg. i Göta hovr. sed. 14, tf. fiskal 15, adj. led. 18, assessor 20, fiskal s. å., tf. rev:sekr. 21-22, hovr:råd 25, v. div:ordf. KN02kl.
translated: Ljungholm, Hans Fredrik, Court of Appeal Councillor, Jönköping, b. 17/8/86 in Visby, son of bank director Herman Pettersson and Helena Ljungholm. Graduated from high school in Visby in 1904, obtained a Bachelor's degree in Uppsala in 1908, and a Law degree in 1911. Became a junior associate notary in the Göta Court of Appeal in 1912, acting district attorney from 1913, served in the Göta Court of Appeal since 1914, acting prosecutor in 1915, judicial trainee in 1918, appointed as an assessor in 1920, acting prosecutor of the same year, deputy secretary of revenue in 1921-1922, appointed as a Court of Appeal Councillor in 1925, and vice chairman of the division. Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa in 1902. Note: The abbreviation "mog" followed by a year denotes marriage in that particular year.
